timeline.title: Birth of Jose Rizal
timeline.short_text: José Protacio Rizal was born on June 16, 1861, in Calamba, Laguna, to Francisco Mercado and Teodora Alonzo.

timeline.title: Early Education in Biñan
timeline.short_text: Rizal began his formal education in Biñan under Maestro Justiniano Aquino Cruz, showing early intellectual promise.

timeline.title: Execution of GOMBURZA
timeline.short_text: The execution of GOMBURZA deeply influenced Rizal's nationalist awakening and shaped his later writings.

timeline.title: Studies at Ateneo Municipal
timeline.short_text: Rizal excelled at Ateneo Municipal, producing poems, sculptures, and achieving academic distinction.

timeline.title: Medical Studies at UST
timeline.short_text: From 1877 to 1882, Rizal studied Philosophy, Letters, and Medicine at UST, completed surveying in 1881, experienced Spanish brutality, formed personal relationships, and earned literary acclaim through works like A la Juventud Filipina and El Consejo de los Dioses.

timeline.title: First Travel Abroad
timeline.short_text: Rizal left the Philippines for Europe to continue his studies and observe Western societies.

timeline.title: Exile in Dapitan
timeline.short_text: Rizal was exiled to Dapitan, where he focused on education, medicine, and community development.

timeline.title: Martyrdom in Bagumbayan
timeline.short_text: Rizal was executed on December 30, 1896, becoming a symbol of Filipino nationalism and resistance.
